captions.text: On top of rails stretching straight
I stand with you like last time
I swallow down my dry throat
Letting air cool off my sweaty back
I went up to you asking about your day
Listened to your same old stories
Trying to tell you I changed for you
You were off track, so why did I
look into your eyes, not look out for your steps
Actions speak louder than words, you know
I'll go up to you, asking for a chance
Then in the silence, waiting for the answer
I'll look for excuses to tell you
We were so out of it
We were so out of it

emotional) when the lyric is BOWLING (pins, scores, etc)... Also, after the 
fantastic English lyrics on much of Hyukoh's 20 EP, I'm thrown by the 
really stereotypical konglish (bowling game) in this one.... Great vibe, 
but Hyukoh is so so much better. ﻿
comments.author: Stephen McGrath

comments.text:
Aah, I've never heard of Hyukoh before but Primary is really into English 
playwords (Johnny for 자니 (Are you sleeping?), Mr. Lee (Mistery), and 
there's some more lol)) but this would apply if Primary did the lyric 
himself though.
comments.author: Anita Ilma N

comments.text:
My interpretation of "bowling game" is its a game of bawling, crying, tears 
running and running down again, they're sad, but they keep playing this sad 
game. Yes, a play of words in general as you all have mentioned. Dope song 
really
comments.author: 100plusminus

comments.text:
That's fair... The play on words is clever. I stand by "bowling game" Nine 
years here has shown me that konglish is rarely intentional (and is hard to 
detect since it so often isn't)
